title: Crystal Palace open talks with Liverpool over defender Mamadou Sakho
text:
Crystal Palace open talks with Liverpool over defender Mamadou Sakho However, there are huge obstacles to overcome because of the £20million price tag and his big wages Share Mamadou Sakho is wanted by Crystal Palace (Photo: David Price) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Crystal Palace boss Sam Allardyce has talked to Liverpool about out-of-favour defender Mamadou Sakho . 
But there are huge obstacles to overcome because of the £20million price tag and his big wages which would be a problem for Palace's wage structure. 
Liverpool want a permanent deal but Palace not close on agreement. 
The £16million defender was sent home from the club’s pre-season tour of America and had previously infuriated club officials by taking a fat-burner which subsequently saw him miss the end of last season. Read More All the latest news, gossip, speculation and done deals on the final day of the January transfer window The defender has been frozen out at Anfield (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty Images) 
Sakho was initially banned, and despite the club fighting his corner and that ban being overturned, the club weren’t happy he had elected to use a product without approval from the club’s medical staff. 
Speaking on the incident in America, where he turned up late for both a team meeting and a recovery session, Sakho told Canal Football Club: “It is true that I turned up late. There was a rule that I should have observed. I do not at all see myself as above the rules, I respect everyone. 
“I paid my fine, I was sanctioned, I apologised to my team-mates and my manager. 
"Aside from that… I do not want to go into the controversies.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
